attributes.action: Have Sunderland's city of culture bid removed for failing to empty litter bins.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Render, as I informed you at our meeting I am undertaking a review of the bins across the city therefore I am not in a position to replace, remove or upgrade any one bin at this time
Thanks
Mark

From: david render  
Sent: 27 July 2016 18:09
To: 
Subject: bin always overflowing.

Mark please fined enclose pictures and location of bin,
This bin is always overflowing if you don't fit a new high capacity bin within 14 days at this location,
I will take Sunderland council to court, I have picked up 165 bags of litter this year and too many from this location.
I now have a collection of over 1,500 pictures of bins overflowing in Washington this year.
I want action on this, you know I don't bluff?
attributes.background: Sunderland council are refusing to keep Washington New Town's streets clean, they blame government cuts, when i think they are using the street cleaning budget to fund this bid.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

You may already have raised your issue with a local councillor who represents you. If not, you can use this page to find out who your local councillors are and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could also start a new petition on the Sunderland City Council petitions site. You can find out more here:

http://sunderland-consult.limehouse.co.uk/portal/petitions

If you would like to complain about your council, you can find out more about how to do that here:

https://www.gov.uk/complain-about-your-council

We have removed the name from your petition, because we do not publish the names of individual officials of a public body, who aren't part of the senior management. This is against our terms and conditions.
